com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.networkclasses.retrofitutilities.serviceapiinterfaces

Class ProfanityCheckerAPICalls

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.networkclasses.retrofitutilities.serviceapiinterfaces.ProfanityCheckerAPICalls

  • public class ProfanityCheckerAPICalls
extends java.lang.Object
    This serves as a wrapper class for accessing the PurgoMaluminterface. Use it to check for curse words / profanity in a String. Class Uses Permission android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE. PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum Created by pmacdowell on 8/29/2016.

      This will make a web call to check for profanity in a word passed in.

      This will make a web call to check for profanity in a word passed in.

    • Method Detail

      • checkProfanityAsynchronous

        public static void checkProfanityAsynchronous(@NonNull
                                              android.content.Context context,
                                              @NonNull
                                              OnTaskCompleteListener listener,
                                              java.lang.String curseWordToCheck)
        This will make a web call to check for profanity in a word passed in. NOTE! This does handle asynchronous behavior and will therefore return the data along the listener; this method will always return null as a result.
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        listener - Listener to send the data back on OnTaskCompleteListener
        curseWordToCheck - String word to check if it contains profanity

      • checkProfanity

        public static java.lang.Boolean checkProfanity(@NonNull
                                               android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String curseWordToCheck)
        This will make a web call to check for profanity in a word passed in. NOTE! This does NOT handle asynchronous behavior and assumes that this will be called within a thread or AsyncTask. If this runs without the aid of an asynchronous thread, it will throw the error
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        curseWordToCheck - String word to check if it contains profanity
        Returns:
        True or false if parsed correctly, null if it parses incorrectly
        Throws:
        android.os.NetworkOnMainThreadException - Will throw if not run on an Asynchronous thread
